timeline.message:
Always deletes left-over blobs if a reference changes.

If a new blob key is placed in a reference, we previously
only marked the old blob as deleted, if a new one was given.

However, if the reference is cleared (set to null), we still should
mark the previously referenced blob as deleted.

Also updates the in memory blob when updating the metadata store.

We previously only updated the underlying database but left the given
blob filled with the previous values. This is kind of unexpected for
the caller of "update", therefore we also update the in-memory blob
(without a fetch from the database).

Fixes: SIRI-96

Uses the filename in the given blob if available.

This will avoid an unnecessary cache lookup.

Provides a UI component to update the value of a BlobHardRef.

This is done by performing an AJAX upload into a temporary blob.
Once the entity containing the BlobHardRef is persisted,
the blob is marked as non-temporary. Otherwise, the blob is
automatically deleted after a timeout.

The controller provided here supports the actual AJAX call.

Note that the UI is very rudimentary and more or less a copy of
storedObjectUploader.html.pasta. This needs some love+work
in the near future.

Fixes: SIRI-96

Prevents a NPE when a BlobHardRef is set to null.

Previously we tried to determine which space is used
by using ref.getBlob().getStorageSpace(), we now use
a newly helper method provided by the BlobHardRef which
is smart enough to lookup the space, if no blob is present.
